Name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Grand Slam Expansion Pack
Description:
This expansion includes more free players of all three types, naturals, robots and cyborgs. That add more variety of players than there will be in the year 2045. New mechanics to the base game, to give more depth to this game.

This expansion includes the first 10 Expansions for Baseball Highlights: 2045

Contains 130 Total Cards

Breakdown:

Coaches Expansion (CO) - (15 Coach Cards that add another level of strategy to the game)
Rally Cap Expansion (RC) - (15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck)
Naturals & Magna Glove Expansion (NM) - (10 new Natural cards for the Free Agent Deck)
Robot Hitters Expansion (RH) - (10 new Robot cards for the Free Agent Deck)
Cyborg Pitchers Expansion (CP) - (10 new Cyborg cards for the Free Agent Deck)
Errors! Expansion (ER) - (15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck)
Big Fly! Expansion (BF) - (15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck)
Ballparks Expansion (BP) - (10 cards that provide a new game mechanic, Home Ballpark)
Home Cookin' Expansion (HC) - (15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck)
Double Trouble Expansion (DT) - (15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck)

Name: Galatune: Cosmic Deception
Description:
The Cosmic Deception Expansion Pack is the first deck booster for Galatune, including 32 new action cards emphasizing traps, darkness, back-stabbing, and evil underhanded strategies. It can be mixed into your Galatune Starter Deck to customize and expand gameplay options.

Cards Included:
Masquerade, Savage Creed, Divine Annul, Cloneroot, Arms of Ken-daal, Grand Theft, Poetic Justice, Inhibitor, Blight, Kiss of Betrayal, Temporal Revision, Chromashift, Despair, Mega Boost, Treaty, Overload, Confiscate, Shadows of the Past, Confound, Deathwish, Infinite Power, Numbness, Twist of Fate, Pacify, Evil Plot, Magnificent Sacred Phoenix Rebirth, Borrowed Body, Edge of Ages, Manaswap, Omni, Stupid Rock.

Name: Geoscope
Description:
A fun and educational geography game of Ontario!

Geoscope is the original geography series of games* that offer a visual representation of our world. The games are exciting to play and fun to learn on the gameboard maps.

In series* 007/009, Ontario, the players get to know the province through the race along the path from the southernmost region to the northernmost area using "Place" cards, which tell you about the city you've landed on and advance you forwards, and "Chance" cards, which contain trivia about the Ontario and the board itself. Get the answer to a Chance card wrong, and you'll move backwards to the closest safe space on the board.

The winner of the game is the first player to reach Polar Bear Provincial Park at Winisk.

* While the publisher description indicates an intent to release a series of games, it appears that the Ontario game was the only release.

Name: Sprites: Battle Arena
Description:
Players compete for fame in a popular, non-lethal sport, Sprites Battle Brawl. Within the walls of The Arena, contestants attack and defend against each other to show off their skills. And they do so with powerful companions called Sprites. It's the Energy of Sprites that players must harness to power and fuel all of the various tools and weapons that are used in the Arena. These tools are called Wands. Many of them have unique characteristics and effects. And while using Wands, and Sprites, successfully, the crowd of the Arena will take notice. And it is the crowd who chooses the champion. By collecting their cheers and gaining fans, the winner will be decided and declared champion. To battle in The Arena is to show who can use Sprites the best in this turn-based, free-for-all card game.

—description from the designer

Name: Imnia
Description:
Race to victory in a thrilling game of medieval lordship. Expand your city, recruit characters, rise in economic power and complete quests to gain prestige and increase your influence. In the end only the first to finish a wonder through prestige alone is the winner. Will that be you?

In Imnia you take the role of a medieval lord who, in pursuit of power and glory, seeks to prove himself as a great ruler. To do this and be the first to finish building a wonder in your town you will expand your city by constructing new buildings, from basic ones, to advanced and unique, craft items which you will use to recruit characters, engage in land and sea trade to bring in wealth and exotic resources and finally fulfil quests. Through all of these you will first have to raise your influence to the highest level, 7, and finally transform your influence into coat-of-arms tokens to build a wonder and win.

Imnia is at it's core a race to the finish embedded within a thematic economical strategy game. Each player builds through resource management and card drafting a unique asymmetrical tableau in his player area, representing the buildings and recruited characters in his town. Each such unique tableau gives players asymmetrical powers activated with a custom worker placement mechanic.

Name: The Lost Expedition: The Fountain of Youth & Other Adventures
Description:
The Lost Expedition: The Fountain of Youth & Other Adventures expands the base game with four new, modular additions.

In The Fountain of Youth & Other Adventures, Francisco de Orellana and his band of conquistadors traveled deep into the Amazon and were never seen again. Centuries later, unbelievable reports of men clad in ancient armor armed with sword and arquebus have surfaced. If the rumors are true, de Orellana found the Fountain of Youth and guards it dearly...

Other reports have emerged from the area of a mysterious mountain deep in the jungle, pulling planes crashing down from the sky. There are whispers, too, of a dark curse that the locals call only the Mark. For those foolhardy enough to still journey into the depths of the continent, they best not travel alone.

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Tully Sworn Shields
Description:
The great Houses of Westeros had many other, smaller Houses that paid fealty to them. These bonds could be quite strong, reinforced by marriage. When House Stark sent out its ravens to call their Bannermen, House Tully was quick to lend their arms to the cause. In battle, the Sworn Shields would lock their shields together, side-by-side, creating a nearly-impenetrable wall, on which even cavalry charges could be halted.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Tully Sworn Shields unit box gives House Stark players a bulwark on the battlefield. Sworn Shields can utilize their Shieldwall order to negate hits to their front facing, dulling an enemy charge or subsequent attacks against them. Meanwhile, their trusty longswords will show that this unit isn’t entirely defensive in nature. The set includes twelve miniatures in four different sculpts, along with the unit card and movement tray.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Sworn Swords
Description:
Some units can be judged on their military skills or strength, but in war, when another army is advancing, loyalty is a much more valuable asset. The sworn swords are the bedrock of the strategies of the Stark commanders. They are brave and capable to be sure, but their loyalty to the Direwolf banner can never be questioned. To a man, they would rather perish in battle, than leave one of their brothers behind.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Sworn Swords unit box contains twelve miniature sworn sword figures, one sworn sword unit attachment, a movement tray, and all associated unit cards. These warriors have waited in the frozen north too long, dreaming of battle. They may not be the best equipped units in the war, but they know that shiny armor and pretty swords alone do not make a soldier.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Guardsmen
Description:
Of all the Great Houses of Westeros, there is none more wealthy and ready for war than the Lannisters. Wars are fought with money, and the ability to arm troops with the finest steel and equip them with armor to keep them alive and hacking at the enemy goes a long way over the course of a battle.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Guardsmen unit boxes come with twelve Lannister guard figures, one Guard Captain unit attachment, a movement tray, and all associated unit cards. These soldiers are not the fastest, or even the strongest in the war. What they do have is an incredible level of defense, giving them the ability to wear their opponents down. Wars are won by those with the will to continue fighting.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Crossbowmen
Description:
When it comes to training soldiers, crossbowmen require a lot less work than average. The real cost comes in the production of the crossbow, itself. Technological advances aren't cheap, and keeping weapons in working order during war is no easy task. Still, a family with resources like the Lannisters can afford to keep this ranged killing machine armed and ready for battle.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Crossbowmen unit box contains twelve miniature figures in four different sculpts, one unit card, and one movement tray. This unit of deadeye soldiers takes advantage of the technology available to a family of means. At close or long range, their bolts can pierce even thick armor. However, a wise commander will keep them away from melee charges, if possible.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Cutthroats
Description:
On a battlefield where the fighting is done up close and personal, a reputation for vicious brutality can be just as effective a weapon as any blade or bow. The Bolton cutthroats have simple armor and only a spiked mace at hand, but they are coldly efficient at cutting down enemies with much more elaborate armaments.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Cutthroats unit box contains twelve different Bolton cutthroat miniatures in four different sculpts, one Dreadfort Captain unit attachment, a movement tray, and all of the associated unit cards. The cutthroats specialize in driving fear into their opponents, and with the vicious trait, they'll be able to force their enemies to fail panic tests on a regular basis. It's one thing to read about war in books; it's quite another when you're standing across the field from men who kill for sport!

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Heroes of Stalingrad: Battlegrounds
Description:
Expand the war to the industrial sectors of Stalingrad with the ammunition factory (on 2 terrain boards), 2 new heroes, and 2 new platoons for each army, roads, buildings and more!

				
				
					Contents of the Kickstarter Edition:				
				
					Russian Units
     Rifle Battalion, 270th Rifle Regiment, 10th NKVD Divisio (Russian Platoon)
     Shturmovye Gruppy, Stalingrad Academy of Street Fighting (Russian Platoon with elite troops)
     Papa Koulikov (Russian Hero)
     Sasha and the Beasts, 270th Rifle Regiment, 10th NKVD Division (Russian Heroic Platoon) - Kickstarter Exclusive
     2 Aircraft (LAGG-3, YAK-78) - Kickstarter Exclusive
     Vasily Zaytsev, Sniper (Russian Hero) - Kickstarter Exclusive
     Extra units and options (T60 Scout Tank, Sharpshooters, RPG40 Grenades, Concealed, Sprinter, Hardboiled, Overwatch, Initiative, …)


				
				
					German Units
     Panzergrenadiere, III. Battalion, Pzgr-Reg 26, 24. Pzr-Div. (German Platoon)
     Aufklärungsabteilung 40, 24. Panzer-Division (German Platoon with elite troops)
     David Kintz (German Hero)
     Die Geisterabteilung, The Ghostly Recons (German Heroic Platoon) - Kickstarter Exclusive
     2 Aircraft (STUKA, MESSERSCHMITT) - Kickstarter Exclusive
     Major König, Sniper (German Hero) - Kickstarter Exclusive
     Extra units and options (Artillery Spotter, Stug III, Overwatch, …)


				
				
					Terrain
     Terrain Tiles (4 Double-sided Road/Terrain Tiles)
     Working Class District (4 Small Houses)
     The Factory (2 Double-sided Terrain Boards)
     The Factory Mini Campaign (3 linked scenarios)
     Heroes of Stalingrad: Battleground Set #5 â€“ The Sewers (4 punch boards, available separately)
     Battlegrounds Storage Box (Terrain Board Storage) - Kickstarter Exclusive
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Mendelius
Description:
Mendelius is a card game for which one or more Mendelius decks are needed (a deck for every two players). The goal is to be the first player to make different combinations of cards, or crossings. Mendelius is an educational game that presents the genetic basis of the Mendelian inheritance.

A game of Mendelius is played in seven rounds. In each round you have to perform several predetermined crossingss whose difficulty increases as the game progresses, as in other card games such as Gin Rummy. The winner of the round discounts 10 points, while the other players are assigned a score corresponding to the sum of the value of the cards that have been left in their hands at the end of the round. The winner is the player with the lowest score at the end of the game.

Name: Wet Blanket
Description:
It's time to party!
...NOT!

This is a game where you try to make people leave a party and go to your own instead!
Implement a series of cards designed to make everyone have a terrible time at the current party.  Whoever collects the most party guests wins!

Game Objective:  Each player is a wet blanket that wants to break up a party by causing socially awkward situations.  The person with the most people in their personal party by the time the main party is emptied or ended wins the game.

Start out with 8 guests in the middle of the table, which represents the current party.  Each player is dealt 4 cards, on their turn a player plays a card then draws back up to 4.

Multiple card types include:
Party Guest
Disaster
Event
Food/Music
Veto
Super Veto

Name: Wet Blanket: Soggy Biscuit
Description:
The parties just got worse!

This expansion deck to Wet Blanket comes with 54 additional cards that will ensure that no one will ever party ever again!  Unless they're at your party of course.

This time you will use your knowledge of people's professions and allergies to make your own party the only one people will ever talk about!

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Silas Marsh Promo Cards
Description: This is a set of four cards to add Silas Marsh to Arkham Horror: The Card Game. They were included with copies of the novella The Deep Gate.
Families: Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – Books & Replacement Cards
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Innsmouth Conspiracy
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Fleet Troopers Unit Expansion
Description:
With the Fleet Troopers Unit Expansion, you can bring those soldiers' dedication and readiness for battle to your games of Star Wars: Legion. This expansion immediately opens up the options available to your Rebel armies with seven unpainted, easily assembled fleet trooper miniatures. An assortment of upgrade cards lets you customize your fleet troopers to match the battles you expect to face. After all, whether you're battling in the tight corridors of a starship or on a more open battlefield, your fleet troopers can make the difference in your fights.

—description from the publisher

Name: Just 1 More Cat
Description:
This is a cat-themed card game with a lot of luck and a lot of directed spite.  It has two decks -- one with action effects and one with cat photos, each with a cute description and a point value.  Players draw and use actions to collect cats worth the most points.

From the back of the box:

Just 1 More Cat is an all ages card and dice game where the champion of the game adopts the most cast.  Players adopt cats from the cat herd, then trade, steal, and adopt more (you guessed it) cats.

Watch out for cat fights and Catmaggedon.

Name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Earth vs Wind
Description:
Welcome to world of Dark Legacy. A world ruled by the ruthless battle mage by the name of the Kaiser. The planet of Titan is at war. The Kaiser is bringing the world to its knees. This is a war where anything is possible and anyone can become a legend. It is here where your journey begins.

Dark Legacy is a unique strategy game that mixes the best elements of campaign-style adventure games and tactical customizable card games and wraps them all up into an in-depth sci-fi/fantasy story. In Dark Legacy, players are no longer bystanders of the battle, they get to be part of it as a war general within one of six different factions. With the unique and various weapons, armor, and relics, that a player can equip themselves with, players can become whomever they imagine themselves to be.

In Dark Legacy, it is the players objective to destroy their opponents and their armies, by building a deck of magic spells that no one can withstand, rolling the d20 in their favor and strategically summoning their army to be the strongest. Just like in a real battle you will have to anticipate the probability of the unexpected. Don't make choices too hastily for they may be the demise of your army and yourself.

Name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Chaos vs Tech
Description:
Welcome to world of Dark Legacy. A world ruled by the ruthless battle mage by the name of the Kaiser. The planet of Titan is at war. The Kaiser is bringing the world to its knees. This is a war where anything is possible and anyone can become a legend. It is here where your journey begins.

Name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Darkness vs Divine
Description:
Welcome to world of Dark Legacy. A world ruled by the ruthless battle mage by the name of the Kaiser. The planet of Titan is at war. The Kaiser is bringing the world to its knees. This is a war where anything is possible and anyone can become a legend. It is here where your journey begins.

Name: Machinations: A Game of Devious Schemes
Description:
Machinations is a competitive tabletop game where players take the role of a soothsayer, zombie, superhero and more in order to complete their own agendas. While roaming the board, players discover new locations that may help them on their mission or reveal an obstacle that they must face. The board changes according to which combinations of characters are in the game for a unique experience every game. During a special phase called covert operations, players get to secretly perform their special abilities in order to get one step closer to winning the game.

Do you have what it takes to save the day from the alien invasion? Will you find the path to the buried treasure? Keep your identity hidden and get ahead by sabotaging other opponents. Just be careful or you might get sucked into the black hole or encounter the raging robot. Will you be the first to fulfill your Machination?

Name: SpaceCiv
Description:
The humans cannot live on Earth. The nuclear war has created new a new species,who,with their special powers,have taken over whole earth without any difficulty.

So you, along with the other survivors have shifted to a new planet in a far away galaxy. And you are their leader. Can you successfully create a civilization? Probably, and then, probably not.

Each turn a new disaster will occur upon your civilization and you have to use your military and resources to protect your civilization.
SpaceCiv is a solo PnP game. In this game, you cannot win.At the end of the game, you will be given Victory Points based on  your surviving buildings.

—description from the designer

Name: Stones Break Bones: The Perfect Mix of Strategy & Luck
Description:
Stones Break Bones is a card game with just one simple goal - to gain exactly 25 points, no more no less. The gameplay is just as simple, pick up cards from the main pile and add up the points on them, but be sure to avoid stones! Those pesky cards force you to discard your whole hand to the discard pile. Boosters, on the other hand, make for a great surprise to your opponent. Play them at the beginning of your turn to throw off your opponents and get an advantage over the gameplay.

The design of the cards is slick, with hand-drawn icons on each card. Unlike many other popular card games, Stones Break Bones is pocket size (1.75in x 2.5in) - perfect for parties and road trips!

—description from the designer

Name: Petty Fiefs
Description:
Minor princes pit bands of vassals and fickle mercenaries against one another in a struggle to possess the largest and most valuable tracts of land. Later, the princes build and upgrade castles to secure control of their expanding realms. The player whose weaker prince has the strongest, most valuable fiefdom wins.

Petty Fiefs is a game for the piecepack played in two phases:
Lay of the Land, where players lay out the tiles to make the starting provinces and places the princes and warlord into them;
and Contention, where players fight to gain control of the provinces by moving their princes, placing vassals, bidding for control of the warlord, placing mercenaries etc. and then secure control of their provinces by building and upgrading castles.

The game ends when there are no uncontrolled provinces and players total up the values of the provinces for each of their princes and the player whose lowest scoring prince has the highest score wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tacticon
Description:
A strategy game which aims to be an abstraction of contemporary society in the same way that Chess is an abstraction of feudalism. Each player has ten pieces: a man, woman, and child (people); a wheel, column and bullet (tools); a shield; and three pragmas. People and pragmas cannot attack people, and the child cannot attack tools. Shields cannot be attacked at all except from behind.

The object of the game is to score points by attacking the opponent's people and pragmas, or by occupying special spots on the board known as "origons". The game ends immediately if one player occupies all four origons, or if one player has lost two of their three people. Otherwise the game continues until a predetermined score is reached.

—user summary

Name: MINOPOLY
Description: The player who can “see” the most buildings from his side of the board when the game ends is the winner.

Name: Diesta: A Dice Fiesta
Description:
Diesta is a game of minigames: strategic, physical, deceptive, creative, and mind-bending.

You draw a minigame card, play that minigame, win some Diesta cards, and use those cards' special abilities to power-up, sabotage, cooperate, and compete with your friends!

The winner is the player with the most cards at the end of the game. Get ready to have fun, get to know each other, and enjoy the mayhem of Diesta!

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Contract Conquest
Description:
Summary:
In Contract Conquest, you take the role of a wealthy real estate mogul who has decided to build a tower. Unfortunately for you, you are not the only one building towers, and other real estate moguls will do everything in their power to stop you. Can you battle the odds, the elements, and worst of all, the other players to come out on top with the tallest tower?

Game play:
Contract Conquest is a card based tower building game for 2 or more players which can take as little as 30 minutes and can be expanded on to increase the play time up to 2 hours.  Players take turns building rooms in their tower, while playing cards to decimate their opponent's tower and improve their own. All players have to watch out for the disaster cards which can be devastating to all players.

Goal:
Be the player with the most Construction Points (CP) when any player completes the top floor of their tower.

—description from the publisher

Name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Legends
Description:
10 Legendary Units (and their special equipment) that you can play in place of the Nations included in D-Day Dice.

This deck of 60 Cards (10 Poker and 50 Small) includes 10 Legendary Units (and their unique items and specialists).

These units can be used instead of the standard Units in any of the expansions of the core game.

Legendary Units include:

    Royal 22e Regiment
    Polish 1st Armoured Division
    Royal Warwickshire Regiment
    92nd Infantry Division (Buffalo Soldiers)
    9e Compagnie du R_giment du Tchad (La Nueve)
    Brazilian Expeditionary Force (FEB)
    French Foreign Legion
    45th Infantry Division (Thunderbird)
    1st Belgian Infantry Brigade (Brigade Piron)
    No.10 (Inter-Allied) Commando
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Spoils of War
Description: An expansion including 10 Special Missions, 3 War Stories and 46 Servicemen, as well as 2 Awards, 4 Vehicles and 10 War Heroes and a Legendary Unit which includes 2 Legendary Specialists, 3 Legendary Items, and the Legendary RWB Table for the unit.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Gott Mit Uns
Description: The Gott Mit Uns Mini Expansion is a mini-expansion for D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Atlantikwall, containing a 66 cards that can be played on their own or added to their respective original decks, including a rules card, 30 Battle Conditions, 4 German Items, 3 German Specialists, 22 Decorations, and 6 cards of a new Reserve specialist, Radio Operator (2 stars) for French, Canadian, UK, USA, SHAEF, and Polish forces.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Overlord
Description: This expansion includes the full campaign rules, a variant Battle Map of GOLD Beach (with one bunker), Juno Beach II, a token sheet, plus the necessary components to add 2 players to your campaigns: 2 sets of RWB dice, 2 sets of all new Specialists including resource cards (Greece and Norway) and 2 unique Unit Markers, and a full set of Awards, Items and Vehicles. Also included are 4 new and exclusive Awards.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Treadheads
Description:
Treadheads is a new and unique game system that covers Second World War and future combined-arms tactical combat. TH will integrate armor, infantry, artillery and air support for miniatures and hex-based board gaming. The unit level is individual vehicles & aircraft with squads & teams for infantry. Each player will command up to a reinforced combined arms company, confronting the same challenges and fortunes of war as real tank commanders and infantry squad leaders in combat with the enemy.

They will advance to contact, identify and react to threats, engage targets, and then adapt their own battle plans as necessary. TH encourages the use the tactics and strategies, including those taken directly from the real manuals, and features weapons platforms that perform with a high degree of detail & accuracy.

What sets this game apart from other games at this scale & subject? Treadheads centers around the concept of “Time in Action” as a way to simulate the interactive and simultaneous actions of units in a historical 1:1 engagement. This timing synchronizes movement and firing commands and eliminates additional rules and traditional Sequence of Play for initiative determination, orders phase, opportunity fire and over-watch, while allowing simultaneous movement & target engagement.

TH and the OODA Decision Loop: The principle of the Decision Loop (Observe, Orient, Decide, Act) was developed by USAF Colonel John Boyd. By mastering this process and getting "inside" the cycle, disrupting an opponent's thinking processes, and forcing him to commit to a plan before he's ready, this offers opportunities and pressures for him to make mistakes. That timing aspect of acting before your opponent is what allows you to seize the initiative and exploit it.

Name: Rank Card Game
Description:
Rank is a fast-paced shedding card game, which means you try to get rid of all your cards before the other players and obtain the highest rank. In Rank, players utilize numbered cards, special cards, and strategy to out think their opponents and play all their cards first.

The most important thing to remember is to not get stuck with only low cards towards the end, or you’re going to lose!  The first player to get rid of all their cards becomes the King.  Each time a player becomes/stays the King, they receive 2 Royal tokens.  If you end the hand as the Queen, you receive 1 Royal token.  Get 5 Royal tokens and you are the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Mercenaries Expansion Pack #1
Description:
An expansion consisting of mercenary miniatures and their cards. The expansion was initially released as a KickStarter exclusive to backers of the 2017 campaign, but Gamelyn Games has stated that they may also be available for direct sale from their website or at conventions.

The expansion contains:

     4 Miniatures (Gamelyn the Warlord, Jowls the Minotaur, Gnocke the Hill Giant, and Betula the Treant)
     4 Mercenary cards
     1 Rule card
Families: Game: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea

Name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Mercenaries Expansion Pack #2
Description:
An expansion consisting of mercenary miniatures and their cards. The expansion was initially released as a KickStarter exclusive to backers of the 2017 campaign, but Gamelyn Games has stated that they may also be available for direct sale from their website or at conventions.

The expansion contains:

     2 Miniatures (Mechmaster Cyd the Harvester, Baaledor the Demon Lord)
     2 Mercenary cards
     1 Rule card
Families: Game: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea

Name: Malifaux: Snow Storm
Description:
At the time of the Event, the Tyrant December made a desperate gamble to take control of His Vessel, Rasputina. This attempt failed when she redirected His power to one of the Silent Ones, a woman named Snow. The Tyrant's power manifested in the form of a massive wendigo bound to Snow, which later was named Storm.

At first, the relationship between the two was fractured and hostile. Neither the wendigo nor the Silent One wanted this symbiotic relationship, but Fate is rarely inclined to offer a true choice. As time has moved on, they have developed a respect for each other, moving from animosity to the kinship of pack siblings.

They no longer interact much with the Cult, preferring their own company. While they answer to Rasputina, it is a strained relationship compared to the rest of the Silent Ones. Storm's nature has driven Snow more towards independence, and she is more willful as a result. For now, the two are joined with the Cult's cause.

—description from the publisher

Name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Siege Engines Mini-Expansion
Description:
An expansion consisting of six siege engines and their cards. The expansion was initially released as a KickStarter exclusive to backers of the 2017 campaign, but Gamelyn Games has stated that they may also be available for direct sale from their website or at conventions.

The expansion contains:

     6 Siege engine constructs (3 types)
     6 Siege engine cards
Families: Game: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea

Name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Nomads Mini-Expansion
Description:
An expansion consisting of "troll" nomad miniatures and their cards. The expansion was initially released as a KickStarter exclusive to backers of the 2017 campaign, but Gamelyn Games has stated that they may also be available for direct sale from their website or at conventions.

The expansion contains:

     10 Nomad miniatures
     1 Nomad mercenary card
     6 Nomad spell cards
     1 Rulesheet
Families: Game: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea

Name: Malifaux: Beacon of Knowledge – Sandeep Box Set
Description:
Sandeep Desai was born in Guild-occupied India. He was one of the many orphans of his city, and he was taken in and raised by a temple. He devoured books on the arcane and soon proved to be a powerful user of magic in his own right, but his peaceful life of learning came to a violent halt the day that the Guild arrested his master for undermining their authority. Sandeep took up his Master’s cursed Gada that day and unleashed the fury of Banasuva for the first time.

Sandeep was personally asked to come to Malifaux by Viktor Ramos in order to help train a new generation of Arcanists in the ways of magic. He holds his classes in secret, instilling in his students a respect for the arcane which he wishes he had on that fateful day back in India. He is an excellent teacher, and Ramos has been pleased with the progress of his students.

The locations of his classes frequently move, staying one step ahead of the Guild. In quiet moments of reflection and meditation, Sandeep often regrets the need for violence and wishes for a peaceful, quiet environment where his students could grow and prosper. He knows the tyranny and cruelty of the Guild all too well, and constant vigilance prevents him from dwelling on his own dark past.

Sandeep’s box set contains six models, including Sandeep himself. Kudra, Sandeep’s loyal student, is his right-hand-woman, and she defends her teacher with arcane skill and physical prowess. Sandeep can summon his Totem, Banasuva, to present a large, flaming threat for his opponent. Finally, the Poison Gamin are versatile Minions which Sandeep is also capable of summoning.

—description from the publisher

Name: Just Borrowin'
Description:
In Just Borrowin’, you take on the role of a family of tiny people who live under the floorboards, in the walls and in the nooks and crannies of a nice big house of rich and forgetful humans. Each night, you venture out to “borrow” items to make your tiny house bigger, better and nicer to live in. But beware of fellow tiny people, who are also trying to furnish their homes, and won’t hesitate to scuffle with you for the items they want.

What’s more, you have to look out for the cat, the ferocious pet of the humans, whose keen senses know when there’s a scuffle among the tiny people. Avoid the cat at all costs, or you’ll be cat food. Survive the scuffles and the feline wrath, and you’ll return with the materials to decorate your home. You can even assemble borrowed items to create more elaborate furniture. If you accomplish your goals for a dream home, you’ll be the envy of all tiny people.

This is a card-based game where 3-5 players start of with just a an empty room card. Their ideal dream home is dictated by goal cards drawn at the start of each game. Each turn, item cards are presented and all players simultaneously place their meeples on the items they want to grab. If two or more players go after the same item card, a scuffle breaks out. Scuffles are resolved with dice rolls but if the difference exceeds two, the cat will hear and disrupt the scuffle. Everyone flees and no one gets the item.

Players decorate their room card with the item cards. There are also Assembly cards where players are required to get two or more specified item cards to build into the Assembly. Assemblies score more and give action bonuses. Players may also trade items with each other, expand their tiny house by adding room cards. Play ends when there are no more item cards to grab. Then points are added. Item cards, Assembly Cards and Goal cards are scored and totalled.

—description from the designer

Name: Planet Apocalypse: Lord Jabootu
Description:
"Jabootu, a new Demon Lord – the evil spirit of terrible movies and television!"

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:

     1 Lord figure (Lord Jabootu)
     1 Lord Sheet


A Crossover from Planet Apocalypse officially published by Petersen Games makes this miniature compatible with Cthulhu Wars.

For Cthulhu Wars it is also a Independent Great Old One with the following powers:

Deadly Tedium (Pre-Battle): If Jabootu is in play, the enemy rolls 1 less combat die in any battle against you.

Spellbook - (Criticism) Requirement: Jabootu is in a battle declared by another player.
Criticism (Post-Battle): From now on, if Jabootu is in a battle, the enemy receives 1 less Kill result (minimum of 0).

Name: Planet Apocalypse: Lady Scylla
Description:
"Scylla, a new Demon Lady with six heads, which must be destroyed separately."

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:

     1 Lord figure (Lady Scylla)
     1 Lord Sheet
     6 Deadhead Markers


A Crossover from Planet Apocalypse officially published by Petersen Games makes this miniature compatible with Cthulhu Wars.

Name: Planet Apocalypse: Lord Pulgasaur
Description:
"Pulgasaur, a new Demon Lord who grows in stages as you battle him."

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:

     1 Lord Sheet


A Crossover from Planet Apocalypse officially published by Petersen Games makes this miniature compatible with Cthulhu Wars.

Description:

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Name: Cats are Scientists
Description:
All throughout history, cats have theorized the idea of gravity. Now, cats from all over the world are testing the principles of gravity by knocking objects off of tables and recording the outcome. It is up to you to successfully conduct enough experiments to formulate enough evidence to prove the Law of Gravity. The cat who can successfully complete this task first will forever go down in history as the cat who discovered gravity!
The idea of the game is to collect 6 or more science points to be deemed the "Greatest Science Cat of All Time!" In order to conduct an experiment, you must knock a card off of the table using your Scientific Method. You then apply the rule on the card to the game and MUST follow it to the best of your ability. If you fail to follow a rule in play and another player calls you out on it, you must return a card back into the pile. See who can follow the most laws of science by stacking up more and more rules!

Name: Battlegroup: Torch
Description:
EGYPT, 1942... After defeat at the Battle of Gazala, the British 8th Army has been chased back through the western deserts, fighting a rearguard action to hold the line near a railway halt called El Alamein.  Here, the tide of the desert war would turn decisively in the British’s favour. At El Alamein Rommel’s weary army was repeatedly defeated and forced into a very long retreat to save itself. Meanwhile, American and British troops land on the shores of Morocco and Algeria in Operation Torch, with the plan to cut-off the Germans by capturing Tunisia. A hard seven-month campaign would follow in the final struggle to capture North Africa.

• BACKGROUND A general overview of the later North Africa campaign, from Gazala, through three battles at El Alamein to Operation Torch and the Allies’ attack into Tunisia. With British, American and French forces of 1st Army in the north and 8th Army pursuing Rommel’s Panzer Armee Afrika to the Mareth Line, and then beyond, in the south. This book covers the desert fighting from May 1942 to May 1943 and the Axis’ ultimate surrender in Tunisia.

• ARMY LISTS Nine army lists designed to be played with the character of the principal combatants for North Africa: the veteran Deutsche Afrikakorps for 1942 and Defenders of Tunisia for 1943, Italian armoured and infantry divisions to face British (and Commonwealth) armoured and infantry divisions. Also, for Tunisia, the first combat operations for the US 1st Armoured Division and US infantry divisions, as well as ex-Vichy French ‘March’ divisions, now turned against their former Axis allies.

• SPECIAL RULES New special rules to adapt the core Battlegroup rules to the later North African battlefields. Recreating the character of desert fighting, with its dusty conditions, reliance on tank warfare and mobile formations, and the wearing effects of the harsh conditions. Also rules for the colder, muddy, difficult hill-country of northern Tunisia, a very different type of battlefield, all helping to create games with the distinctive feel for the end of the ‘desert’ war.

Name: Planet Apocalypse: Lord Great Cthulhu
Description:
"The Great Cthulhu himself has come, summoned by the powers of hell itself! Also comes with 20 sanity tokens. When you battle Great Cthulhu, madness makes it difficult for heroes to decide when to retreat!"

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:
- 1 Lord figure (Lord Great Cthulhu)
- 1 Lord Sheet
- 20 sanity tokens

Name: Rival Realms: Far Frontiers Expansion
Description:
Fantastiqa Rival Realms: Far Frontiers Expansion adds powerful Relics to Rival Realms.

Components:
2 - Player Aid Cards
2 - Enchantment Cards
2 - Quest Cards
14 - Relic Tokens
1 - Instructions

Relics are chosen at random and placed in the 4 corners of your Realm. You must explore the corner regions of your Realm to claim the Relics!

Fantastiqa Rival Realms is a standalone game for two players, and the Final Frontiers expansion is a separate addition for the game.

Description:
A collection of fan-designed scenarios available through the-overlord.com

Eighteen scenarios, the last three forming a mini-campaign.

40 pages
