Description:
A collection of fan-designed scenarios available through the-overlord.com

Twelve scenarios, ten of which form a campaign. Additionally, five articles:


     How to Make a Monster: Thog (title in English in the original), by Stephane N'Guyen
     La Part de l'hôte (short story), by Not Quite Dead
     Guide de peinture : Thog, by Martin Grandbarbe
     THS : du mode aventure au mode versus (game design), by Fred Henry
     Thog (short story), by Pallantides


52 pages

Name: Ancient World Multi Game System
Description:
Like streaming music and films for endless entertainment, you can now choose from a growing number of games in the Multi Game System. Each component in this compact system is carefully crafted to play in a wide variety of games, at home or away.

For centuries, playing cards have been used, to play many popular games. Today, quality wood, bronze or printed chip components are used interchangeably to play lots of games. The main components are square tiles, with colors and symbols on both sides. You can play more games, with more players, when you possess more tiles.

When Multi Game System books are released, you can extend your game collection. When new Multi Game System books are released you can expand your game collection. The style or type of games is growing and many games get updated with alternative play or expansions. They are created by casual and prolific designers from the USA, UK and Germany, plus a few classics designed in Ancient Egypt or the Roman Empire.

Build up your game library, step by step, with additional components designed for play with upcoming books. Keep your home clean and the environment green, with these compact and enduring pieces.

The games take you back to the lives of warriors, fishermen and other heroes of the Ancient World. They are easy to learn in a few minutes and can be played in 10 to 30 minutes or more These social abstract games, encourage players to interact in widely differing ways, from fear-driven collaboration, collusion, trickery and bluffing and deceit, and of course, competition. Enjoy adventure in the Ancient World and create your own story.

Chess, Latrunculi, and traditional Seega are strategic battles between two minds with nothing is left to chance and everything is open in plain sight on the battle field. The greatest mind will prevail through skillful use of his forces. Words are not spoken and only detract from victory. The real world has chance and luck, secrecy and concealment which makes Journey Stones and King’s Ransom so much fun. More than two are usually involved in real life, so most of the social abstract games allow four or more to play. The rich relationships between many players, with shifting allegiances or when facing a common challenge are memorable. In set to play for Stella, Inuit, ILIOS or Assyrians, “may keep them hidden from other players”, means you may work together with some players and show your tiles, build trust and enhance cooperation! It’s not enough to use your strategic skill and not open your mouth! Assyrians and Dream Lands rely solely on persuasion and verbal skills.

As you see how the components are used, you may be inspired to add to the library and create your own games, limited only by your creativity.

The tiles can be put together in different combinations to give the components needed to play these 25 games.

MGS

Ziggurats                                    
Journey Stones
Rays
Silk Roads
Numidia                                    
Melos
Latrunculi                                  
Seega
Kush                                        
Stella
Cheetah                                     
King's Ransom
Inuit

PREMIUM MGS

Tekel
Tholos                                      
Capere
Agros

DELUXE MGS

Lost
Floodwaters
Assyrians
Dark Death
ILIOS                                       
Raetia

SUPER DELUXE MGS

Dream Lands
Summons

Some of the games such a Kush and Tholos are available in the system with the enhancements and expansions. Some of the classic public domain games such as Seega & Latrunculi have been updated or expanded for today's players. In the same way, we show you how to play (and even improve) the modern card game King’s Ransom with the MGS tiles.

It is a GAME DESIGN KIT with many styles of tiles, dice and disks for you to expand, design and develop your own games. Dream Lands is more interesting with these extra tiles and Assyrians can now be played with up to 20 players! We are designing new games and expansions which use the designer kit tiles. Take a look at how the components have been used in the 26 games and you will be inspired to design yourself.

You will be surprised how well the components allow you to play so many dice, card, or tile games. Checkers a simple game with the rules readily available online, and even Chess can be played with the MGS tiles. As you successfully implement more complicated games your confidence and ambition will grow.

The tiles can be put together in different combinations to give the components needed to play your own game designs. Game designers should get this kit and test their own games. We are open to publish your game in the next rule books, if it uses these components.

Versions & Extras:

MGS

4 Player 14 Games       80 Square Tiles    Sets A & B

PREMIUM MGS

4 Player 18 Games      120 Square Tiles    Sets A, B & C

DELUXE MGS

5 Player 24 Games      160 Squarer Tiles   Sets A, B, C & D

SUPER DELUXE MGS

6 Player 26 Games       40 Square Tiles    Sets A, B, C, D & E

GAME DESIGNER KIT GDK   40 Square Tiles    Expansion Set F

TREASURE CHEST

8 x 8 Board & Storage

CHESSMEN

16 Black & 16 White Wood Chess Pieces

ILIOS & Capere are also available from Playford Games as standalone games. Capere has cards and marble pieces instead of tiles!

PRINTED CHIP MGS

A mass market printed chip version was released at the Essen Speieltage in October 2019. Either a base set with set A & B or deluxe set with A,B, C & D. These allow players to experience the system at a lower cost.

Name: Matemaatika on lihtne
Description:
Math is simple.

Educational board game to learn mathematics.
10x10 grid game board has numbers 1-100. Roll the dice with "+" and "-" or other mathematical symbols and move forward or backward accordingly. Who reaches on square "100" first is the winner.

Name: Altiplano: Sunny Days
Description:
This mini expansion came with Spielbox 01/18.

It adds three new boats, three new houses, one order and one mission.

Boats (3):

    3 coins
    1 corn
    1 food and 1 cart


Houses (3):

    +1 point per 2 food
    +1 point per corn
    +1 point per 4 coins


Orders (1):

    1 corn, 1 stone, 1 ore: +11 points and 1 corn


Missions (1):

    +9 points if you have the least food of all players (or tied for the least)

Name: Land of Confusion Volume 2: The Battle for Luneburg Heath
Description:
If the “balloon had gone up” in Cold War Europe during the 1980s an offensive by the Warsaw Pact and Soviet forces across the North German Plain in West Germany would occur. The central sector of the NATO front here was held by the British Army of the Rhine (BAOR) supported by West German forces.  The terrain along the frontier with East Germany was dominated by the Luneberg Heath, an area marked by swamps, rivers and forested terrain that favored the defenders. Once through here, however, the terrain opened up to flat land that stretched to the Dutch and Belgian borders. A breakthrough here by the Communist forces would also certainly lead to a collapse of any NATO defense of West Germany, and a likely defeat by the forces of the Free World.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of Land of Confusion volume 2: The Battle for Luneburg Heath is composed of the following:

•    Two (one east, one west) 11 by 17 inch map sections.
•    112 un-mounted, double sided units.
•    One Players’ Aid Sheet.
•    Eight pages of rules.
Families: Series: Standard Deck Activation System (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: Einmal haut's hin
Description:
2 or 4 players play the soccer game. All other players are betting on the outcome of the game, using the Toto-slip.

The pawns are placed on the spaces marked with an "A". Movement is only forward and is determined by the roll of a die. No pawn may land on a red space. A goal is achieved by entering the opposite goal with a pawn. If a pawn gets on a space that is occupied by an opposite pawn, the opposite pawn is taken from the board. It may reenter the game on an "A"-space by the roll of a 6. If a 6 isn't used to bring back a pawn, it can be used to move a pawn and roll again.

The game ends, when there is no pawn left on the playing field. The team with the most pawns in the opposite goal wins the game.

Name: Chronicles of Frost: All That Burns
Description:
Steeped in the lore of Mistfall and Heart of the Mists, Chronicles of Frost: All That Burns introduces a new villain, a new hero, and a new mode of play: the cooperative campaign!

With 110 new cards, All That Burns allows you to play a string of five scenarios, unlock new abilities for your heroes, and face one of the iconic villains of Aestemyr: Sigraed the Mistflame. Face off against a potent flamecaster mage driven insane by her lust for revenge, then corrupted and reforged into a living weapon by the ravenous Mists. Foil her plans to set the world ablaze, desperately fight to loosen her grip on Valskyrr, and finally stand against her in battle as legendary heroes of the land.

Once brought down and redeemed, Sigraed is also a playable hero in All That Burns. Beat the cooperative campaign to add Sigraed to your hero roster, or simply play her from the start. After all, the Mists corrupt all, and their twisting power has made adventurers face shadows of their former comrades — or even twisted copies of themselves.

—description from the publisher

Name: Reise durch die Alpen
Description:
The players start at München. Movement is determined by one or two dice. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to arrive at space 102 (Rheinfall) wins the game.

The game was published about 1912.

Name: Lustige Fahrt ins Schlaue
Description:
1. Lustige Fahrt ins Schlaue
Each player gets 10 game token and a car to place on the starting-space. A quiz-card is placed on each grey space and a event-card on each red space. The movement of the cars is determined by a die. If a car lands on a pace neighbouring an event-card, the player has to follow the instructions printed on the card. If a car lands on a space besides a quiz-card the player has to answer the question on the card. If the answer is correct, he collects the card. All used cards are imediatly replaced by new ones.

The first player to reach the finish space receives 6 game token, the second gets 3 token. The game ends, when the second player reaches the finsh. All token and quiz-cards count for 1 point each. The player with the most points wins the game.

2. Quiz-Karussell (backside of the game board)

a) 6er-Karussell: The quiz master takes 40 quiz-cards and 10 event-cards from the deck and places 1 card on each colored space. The player rolls a die and has to answer the question on the quiz-card or follow the instruction on the event-card beside the rolled number. The player may chose betweent two permissible cards because there are two spaces for each number. The game ends, when all 50 cards have been used. Points are awarded for token and collected quiz-cards same as in the game "Lustige Fahrt ins Schlaue"

b) 12er-Karussell: In this game the player rolls a die (1-6) and can't chose between two cards. If he don't knows the answer to a quiz-card he has to pay a token and roll a second time. The second result is added to the first one to determine a second card. If he can't answer the question on the second card, there is no penality involved and his turn ends.

Many of the quiz- and event-cards are traffic related.

Name: Journey to the Overland (2nd Edition)
Description:
The King is old. The kingdom is divided and the great Wizard Morcai is mustering an army atop Fire Castle. From every town in the land the call goes out for heroes to take up the quest for the Five Weapons of Power. Ancient artifacts of immense power capable of giving their wielder the power to be...king! You must heed this call but your quest will not be easy. You must leave your home with only a small supply of modest provisions and brave the Overland's dangers as you seek news and information of the Five Weapons of Power. Along the way you will brave harsh weather, get lost in unfamiliar terrain, encounter powerful and sometimes hostile strangers, enter new towns, visit great castles, make loyal friends and do deeds that will make you a legend. And only if you survive all that will you be worthy to vie for one of the Five Weapons of Power.

Journey To The Overland is a solo tabletop role playing game where you assume the role of a lone traveler journeying throughout the Overland in search of Five Weapons of Power. Play begins in your hometown which will be determined by the race you choose for your character – human, dwarf, elf or native Overlander. From there you will determine your character starting characteristics, starting equipment and first daily action. Each day you must select a daily action that will either involve traveling, resting, working, training or visiting towns and castles to obtain news and information with the ultimate goal being to track down one of the five legendary weapons with the power to make you King!

In this revised 2nd Edition of Journey To The Overland the core rulebook has been completely reorganized for easier reference.  The rules themselves have been expanded to include all new content for Kings Harbor (News & Information, Tavern, Audience with the Harbormaster); new taverns, an expanded supply and equipment table, new distinct News and Information for each town or castle; optional Encumbrance rules to replace the seldom used 'weight' rules; new jobs; a new race (Halflings), a new section on 'Feats', new NPCs, an expanded Ocean Encounter Table, revised rules for falling unconscious and new audience tables for Audiences with King Overlord and the King Thorond of Dwarfhaven.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fang den Hut: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
Fang den Hut: Das Kartenspiel is a card game version of Trap the Cap. Players can either claim a stack or play a card. A card can be played on a stack if it is the same number or if it shares a color with the top card and is higher. A stack can be claimed if it is a player's turn and his card is on top of stack. After all cards have been played, points are scored based on the number of cards players have claimed. The player with the most points wins.
____________
This is not a separately sold game . These 33 cards are an addition to the Classic edition of Fang den Hut!. They only were included in this special 2005 version !

Name: Infinity: JSA Sectorial Army Box
Description:
There was a moment when the proud Japanese, who had been humiliated and treated like second-class citizens by the StateEmpire for far too long, rose up against their oppressors and claimed their freedom. The Japanese Uprising was a brief but terribly intense and savage conflict for which the Japanese paid a high price in blood for their victory but finally managed to tear away from Yu Jing. After the Uprising, the Japanese Secessionist Army, or JSA, has been reformulated based on the figure of the servo-powered samurais, as natural leaders both in spirit and in combat. However, the JSA maintains its nature of being primarily an assault force, because the Bushido doctrine requires no less.

A box with 9 new and incredible miniatures belonging to JSA, a Japan completely independent of Yu Jing, part of the Non-Aligned Armies (NA2). It includes an introductory manual, scenery, dice... everything you need to start with Infinity or expand your collection!

—description from the publisher

Name: Infinity: Uprising
Description:
This is a new expansion book that will mark a before and after in the history of the Infinity Universe. Through the long-awaited JSA and Mercs, the Infinity background goes forward in a way unexpected for many. The Japanese Uprising and their schism from Yu Jing bring forth the Non-Aligned Armies (NA2), a new faction that encompasses JSA, plus StarCo, the Ikari Company, and the Druze Bayram Security, the new Mercenary Companies. Also, Infinity Uprising contains all the Dire Foes, with new material that reveals how their stories are linked and contributed to the Japanese Uprising. After Infinity Uprising, the Infinity Universe will never be the same!

This is a new book for Infinity that provides all the details about the new Non-Aligned Armies (NA2), including the mercenary companies StarCo, the Ikari Company, and the Druze Bayram Security. It also contains first-hand information regarding the Japanese Uprising and the fate of the JSA.

In this book, you will also find the background of all the Dire Foes and their seven new, ready-to-play scenarios, in normal or narrative mode and adapted to the ITS format, and the Sectorial Army Charts of the new JSA and the new mercenary companies.

Name: Four Tribes: Library Edition
Description:
A bloody war between two mighty kingdoms has reached an impasse. Each ruler now turns to the northern tribes in an attempt to form an alliance, and turn the tides. Will you be able to capture the favor of the Four Tribes?

In Four Tribes, you and one other player will be placing cards, according to the rules, to either side of a row of six village cards. Most of these cards you are placing represent provisions that each village is lacking. Your goal is to appease the elder of each village more than your opponent by giving them higher ranked goods.

In addition to provisions, there are a host of special cards that you may employ that might be defensive in nature, or be a devastating blow to your opponent. Hand-management and timing is the key!

Four Tribes is a game of strategy and tactics that is balanced with a bit of luck. Each player draws from their own deck of cards, but each player has the same deck, so while you may draw on the weak-side early on, you will know that powerful cards are coming up that you can capitalize on.

Four Tribes can be setup, played, and put away in about 30 minutes, making it a great lunchtime or filler game. I specifically designed this game to be a game that I can play with my wife and since then have heard from dozens of couples who play Four Tribes regularly.

This newest edition takes everything that was loved about the original version, that was very successful on KickStarter, and boils it down and redevelops it into something that feels much like the original, but is new at the same time.

Contents

28 Card Orange Army Deck 28 Card Purple Army Deck 6 Double-sided Standard Village Cards 6 Double-sided Winter Village Cards 6 Fire Expansion Cards 6 Flood Expansion Cards 3 Longhouse Cards 1 Blizzard Token 12 Village Elder Pawns 42 Wooden Houses (10 each of Blue, Green, Red, & Yellow, and 2 Black) 1 drawstring bag Instruction Booklet

Name: Plunderous
Description:
You are a Privateer in an alternate history Steampunk world, sailing the seas of New Caribbean for wealth and fame. The Royal family, no longer interested in directly governing, have decided to appoint a Governor. Through piracy, pillaging and politics will you amass Loyalists and take your place as leader of New Caribbean.

Plunderous is a game of area control, resource management, hand building, dice manipulation and negotiation. Each round you must strategically assemble a unique Crew to carry out your orders, navigate and explore the islands, manipulate resources and politics, parley with other Privateers, complete personal Patron requests and defend and conquer Ports to acquire resources, influence, rewards and Loyalists. The Privateer with the most Loyalists at the end of the game will be appointed the first Governor of New Caribbean by the Royal family.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Heroes of Black Reach – Cassius and Kragott Promo
Description:
This promo was only available through purchasing the Feb 2018 issue of White Dwarf magazine.

This promo includes the tiles required to add two new characters:
- Cassius: Master of Sanctity (Space Marines - Ultramarines)
- Kragott: Wannabe Boss (Orks)

Name: Courtier: Power Promo Cards
Description:
Text says:

Flexible
Discard your private petition. Draw a new petition from the deck.

Play an influence card

2 copies of this card were included inside AEG's version of Patronize

Name: Mercante: Shipment & Fleeting Promo Cards
Description:
Both cards were included inside AEG's version of Patronize

Shipment: 
Auction the top card of the shipment deck without looking at it

Fleeting: 
Severin & Odette
Each player with an agent assigned to Skulduggery loses two crowns. Remove all ages from Skullduggery and place them in the unassigned agents area

Name: No Thumbs Challenge
Description: No Thumbs Challenge is the hilarious game that calls for fast-moving teamwork creative thinking and maximum dexterity as you and your team members try to execute simple tasks without the use of your thumbs! Using thumb straps, players “attach” their thumbs to their palms and then try to perform tasks like opening a water bottle, applying lip balm, or tying a tie.

Name: Mexican Standoff: The Black Scorpion Promo Card
Description:
JEFE ESCORPIÓN ALFREDO is the wicked wraith of the infamous bandit JEFE ESCORPIÓN NEGRO appearing in the base game of Mexican Standoff. Due to his unpredictable and testy personality only the bravest dare to enter into an alliance with him.

Instead of shuffling into the deck, put the promo card on the table within easy reach. Before playing the first card of the round the player who was dealt Jefe Escorpión Negro of the base game may replace Jefe Escorpión Negro with Jefe Escorpión Alfredo (the one with the black background).

The promo card has two special features:

-    After losing a duel in which the promo card was played as a base card the player may retrieve the promo card and put it back into his hand by discarding one card from his hand. The promo card may not be retrieved if the player has no cards left to discard.
-    The player who won the card of Jefe Escorpión Alfredo with a trick, scores 25 bonus points. In case the player who got the card originally cannot keep it by taking a trick, i.e. another player takes it, the original owner of the card gets -25 points.

After each round replace the promo card with the card of Jefe Escorpión Negro of the base game, put the promo card back on the table and reshuffle the deck to start a new round.

Name: Tjugo vita kossor
Description:
Tjugo vita kossor ("Twenty White Cows") or, formally, Fäbodsspelet Tjugo vita kossor ("The Chalet Game of Twenty White Cows")is a fairly simple roll-and-move game wherein the players try to catch as many white cows as possible. There is different ways to go between the start and the goal and on some spots things will happen - delivered in rhymes - that means additional or fewer cows. Artist were famous Swedish designer Bertil Almqvist (he is also probably the designer of the game).

The publication year is an approximation, estimated on biographic, historic and artistic grounds.

Name: Sverige-loppet
Description:
Sverige-loppet is a bicycle racing game played in segments (or heats) from Haparanda in northern Sweden to Ystad in the south, via Stockholm and Huskvarna and a few other places. There is also penalty rounds in the form of diversions. During the race things will happen, and they are delivered in rhymes. Winner is calculated on somewhat complicated mathematical grounds. It must be considered modern for its age.

The game actually has a real life original race as inspiration, from which it also borrowed its name, Sverigeloppet. (Note that Aristospel calls the game Sverige-loppet (with an hyphen) while in real life (see Community Wiki section) the name was Sverigeloppet (in one word). Both means "The Sweden Race".

Name: Bland Blommor och Blad
Description:
Bland Blommor och Blad ("Among Flowers and Leafs") is an educational game that via dice rolls and set collecting intends to teach the latin names of domestic Swedish flowers. Collecting flowers and learning their names was a compulsory school subject (and considered very important) on the national curriculum in Sweden up to about the 1960's.

This fact, and also that the name of the artist - I-L Biltman - appears on the box makes it fairly safe to date the game to about 1955.

Name: Pussla i kapp
Description:
Pussla i kapp ("Jigsaw Puzzle Contest") is a very simple game from Swedish publisher Aristospel, but the idea was probably not theirs originally. The idea is to be first to complete your puzzle. There is four different motifs to choose from.

From the simple components (only paper) and some of the puzzle motifs and the make of the Aristospel logotype it is safe to assume that this is a war era game.

The persons on the lid might very well be real life persons, but they have not been identified.

Name: Silhouette: Das Würfel
Description:
Another branch in the Silhouette-Family of Games. This time the cards are substituted with dice, which shows different silhouettes on their faces.
Six Variants to play with them. Common denominator is that you try to come up with a word that combine sthe images of two dice thrown.

Name: La zingara
Description:
This board-game is inspired to the famous Italian tv-show, which aired in the '90s.

It's a simple quiz game about traditional Italian proverbs.

Italian slogan: 
« Io so chi sei, e se tu vuoi, ti dico che destino avrai, buona sorte o guai.
Luna Nera sì o no lo vedremo fra un po' con le carte che la Zingara ti fa »

Name: Koncern
Description:
Koncern ("Company Group") or, formally, Aktiespelet Koncern ("The Company Group Stock Game") was Aristospel's contribution to the financial games of Sweden in the period 1950 to 2010. Alga held the licence for Monopol and also published their own Finans. From Lemeco came Kapital and KÃ¤rnan would eventually publish BÃ¶rsspelet/Aktiespelet while Olsen decided to publish Yuppie. A similar game was Marketing from Tre Ringar and also Invest from Harlekin. And this is not the definitive list! All in all, a self-respecting Swedish games publisher needed a financial game.

Koncern is the usual Monopoly-like game were players move around by dice rolls and buys and sells stocks and bonds etc. The publishing year is an estimate made on company historic grounds (the companies that features in the game, that is).

An interesting feature is that the companies in this game were to an high degree part of the Handelsbanken sphere of influence, while competitor Lemeco's contemporary game Kapital connected to the sphere of S-E-Banken.

Name: Auktionsspelet
Description:
Auktionsspelet ("The Auction Game") from Swedish publisher Aristospel is a WWII era game in which the players is given some money and then participates in an auction.

The winner is the player with the most numbers of complete sets of bought items. The auction items is a deck of cards. The game also includes rules, money and a small, very handsome, auctioneer's gavel. All in a small box, that together with the old Aristospel logotype and the absence of expensive or complicated components, makes it fairly easy to date the game to the war years.

Designer and artist is, sadly, not known.

Name: Saxtorpsloppet
Description:
Saxtorpsloppet ("The Saxtorp Race") is a motorcycle racing and betting game from Swedish publisher Alga. It is one of Alga's first games ever.

It has an unusual mechanic since one person handles all six motorcycles and an infinite number of participants can take part and place bets. (It is also possible to be only sex players, each with one motorcycle and in that case it is a normal racing game.)

The game consists of six small wooden motorcycles (with drivers), each mounted on a small sheet of carton, some playing card-size pieces to lay out as the track, and the rules. The track pieces have numbers on both sides, 1 to 6 in different random orders.

When playing the track pieces is laid out in a straight fashion in a random order (which makes the number of possible tracks very high) and one playing piece (motorcycle) is choosen to start. That piece will, when placed on the side of the first track piece, point towards one of the sex numbers (digits) and that motorcycle is then moved along the first. Now the second motorcycle will point towards a number, and so a third motorcycle is moved forward (pointing to a number). And so it goes on.

Eventually one of the already moved motorcycles will be moved a track piece ahead and point to another number on that track piece. In a few moves' time all six motorcycles will be engaged in the race, "promoting" another (or ocassionally itself) to further pieces on the track. Winner is the playing piece (motorcycle) that reaches the last track piece first. The track pieces are double-sided so the race takes place along 24 track sections.

Name: ATS: Leatherneck I
Description:
The first in a three module suite for use with the Advanced Tobruk System, depicting small-unit actions in the Pacific Theater during WWII.

Leatherneck I contains three 11 x 16" non-historic geomorphic maps as well as two new map overlays.  All of the combat and special counters needed for play are included (one is expected to already have ATS system markers) on five half-sized countersheets.  Finally, there are eight new scenarios, all of which employ the provided maps and counters, as well as two sheets of AFV Cards.

Gamers must also own the ATS System Rules and playaids to make use of these products.

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Extra Buildings
Description:
These 3 additional cards were a free promo for the 2018 Kickstarter campaign as part of the Architects of the West Kingdom 2018 Promo.

Museum - Gain 1 Virtue at the end of the game for every 2 Buildings you have constructed.

Graveyard - Immediately discard 1 of your hired Apprentices.

Crane - Immediately place another Worker in the Guildhall to either construct another Building or advance work on the Cathedral.
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Extra Apprentices
Description:
3 additional cards released during the 2018 Kickstarter as part of the Architects of the West Kingdom 2018 Promo.

Peddler - Gain 2 Silver on each Black Market Reset.

Overseer - Always treat the King's Storehouse as if you had 1 additional Worker there.

Enforcer - Gain 1 Gold when sending all captured Workers to Prison.
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Extra Player Boards
Description:
5 additional player boards released during the 2018 Kickstarter as part of the Architects of the West Kingdom 2018 Promo.

Lothaire - Pay 1 less Wood or Stone when advancing work on the Cathedral or constructing a Building.

Clovis - Gain 1 Building card anytime you construct a Building.

Bertha - Gain 2 additional Silver when sending all captured Workers to Prison.

Fara - You may release 1 of your imprisoned Worker during each Black Market Reset.

Hugo - You may spend 2 Silver at any time to avoid taking a Debt.
Families: Series: The West Kingdom Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Raiders of the North Sea: Outsiders
Description:
3 new cards released during the 2018 Kickstarter for Architects of the West Kingdom.

These 3 cards feature characters from Architects that can be added into Raiders of the North Sea. Outsider cards introduce a new crew mechanism: Once hired, players may activate the play ability of an Outsider card at the Town Hall, rather than playing a card from their hand. Doing so does not require them to discard the Outsider from their crew.

Swindler - Gain 1 Gold or 3 Silver
Trickster - Draw 1 Card and play 1 Card
Squire - Gain 1 Armour
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Sussed!
Description:
Sussed! is a personality quiz game.

Your aim is to score the most points by answering questions about other players' likes and dislikes, reactions to things, wishes and opinions. To start, all you need is something for each player to write with. It only takes a few minutes to learn.

Players take it in turns to read a question on their card and the three possible answers out loud. They then secretly choose the answer that best suits them and other players attempt to guess which they chose for points.

The winner is the player with the most points after everyone has asked all 5 questions on their cards.

Name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Lost Realms
Description:
Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Lost Realms combines the two small expansions The Nether Realm and The Deep Realms in one set.

Journey through the realm of Talisman on your quest for the Crown of Command but beware the fiery Pyrochanter, fearsome Titan Wraith, and other Nether Deck enemies that seek to thwart your plans in The Nether Realm expansion. The Nether Realm — designed by Jon New, the man behind the Talisman-dedicated fansite Talisman Island - offers three new alternative endings for Talisman, along with new Nether cards. Fate also plays a part in this expansion, helping against some of the larger foes found in the Nether deck, but it could also prove to be your downfall.

Talisman: The Deep Realms allows you to travel between the Dungeon and the City regions by venturing into the dark, dank, and haunted passages that connect them. You can cross through the two corpse-filled and rat-infested Deep Realms by means of a perilous bridge or venture even deeper into an ancient system of tunnels inhabited by rats, feral pets, and much worse monsters. In the gloomy and perilous Deep Realms you will certainly encounter tremendous danger, but you may also find tantalizing wealth — or even a Talisman.

Name: Enclose
Description: Enclose is played on a 19by19 toroidal Go board with Go stones. If a player encloses an area with their stones they capture all the enemy stones in that area. Players may not place their stones onto intersections on area that is enclosed by their opponent. In order for a stone formation to enclose area, the stone formation must be able to have imagined a string with the shape of a polygon connecting the centers of all of its stones so that each center is connected by the string to exactly two other centers of adjacent enclosing formation stones, and that string must divide the toroid into exactly two regions so that it is not possible to move from one region to the other without going through the string. Of these two regions of the toroid that are divided by the string, the one that is enclosed is the one which has a combined value of the measures of the angles of its side (its side being at all points adjacent to the string), that is smaller than that of the other region. Players may pass their turn without placing a stone, if both players pass this way consecutively, the game ends, and the winner is the player who has the most empty intersections enclosed.

Name: AFFLICTION: Salem 1692 – Tactics Card Add-on Pack
Description:
This Kickstarter bonus pack of eight cards (plus one rule card) gives players the option to purchase colonist enhancements.

The eight cards are shuffled and two are turned face up. A player may send a messenger to assign a tactic card to a colonist.

Cards include such traits as Opposition, Rumors, Political Maneuvering, Petition, Rousing Speech, and Pardon from the Governor.

They were initially added to Kickstarter copies of the base game in a separate package. They are still handed out by the publisher at conventions.

Name: Panic Mode!
Description:
Panic Mode! is a cooperative Disaster Recovery card game for up to 8 players. In 25 minutes your doors will open for business, your website will start to hit peak hours, newspapers will be published, blogs will be posted and it will be another day. The problem is your systems are down!

The Mainframe, Morale and Customer Satisfaction tracking cards start at zero. You and your team must work together to recover all three to their safe zones by playing cards. Cards will either increment or decrement one or more tracking cards, and cards may align with your assigned role to have an additional effect.

If players can get all tracking cards to their safe zones in 25 minutes, they win!

Name: Mage Knight: Ultimate Edition
Description:
Combining elements of RPGs, deck-building, and traditional board games, the Mage Knight Board Game puts you in control of one of seven powerful Mage Knights as you explore (and conquer) a corner of the Mage Knight universe under the control of the Atlantean Empire. Build your army, fill your deck with powerful spells and actions, explore caves and dungeons, and eventually conquer powerful cities controlled by this once-great faction! In competitive scenarios, opposing players may be powerful allies, but only one will be able to claim the land as their own. In cooperative scenarios, the players win or lose as a group. Solo rules are also included.

Mage Knight: Ultimate Edition contains the base game; The Lost Legion, Shades of Tezla, and Krang Character expansions; comprehensive integrated rules text; five new cards; and miniatures with alternate paint jobs.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Basketball Duel
Description:
Basketball Duel is a fast card game for 1/2/4 players that simulates a basketball game. Players attack and defend in turns and following basketball possession rules. It is an action/reaction game, with bluffing, hand management and luck.

Cards are divided in two parts, an attack action and a defensive action. The basic layer of the game is using colors, each attack has a color and defensive cards cancel one or more colors. But there is much more to it, you are able to move to different positions, some cards have effects when or when not canceled. Most basketball elements are simulated too: rebounds, fast breaks, interceptions, fouls, bad shots, dunks, blocks...

Each round feels different with all the possible combinations and players have few important decisions to take in each turn that can change completely the result of each round.

Basketball Duel thread for contest

—description from the designer

Name: Dinosaur Island: Totally Liquid
Description: Dinosaur Island: Totally Liquid adds components needed to play Dinosaur Island with up to five players, in addition to adding water dinosaurs to the base game, new parkboard extensions, executive worker meeples that give unique worker abilities to each player, a blueprints module that rewards players when they build certain park layouts, PR events that create hidden scoring opportunities, and more.

Name: Eldenia
Description:
You are Eldenia's hero and adventurer. They prepare to go on adventure by polishing swords and purchasing items in the village. If you're ready, let's go hunting monsters!

In order to gain more fame, you will compete fiercely with the adventurers you join. Sometimes it helps and sometimes it is a stumbling block. Let's be a stronger warrior and defeat the dragon!

In World of Eldenia, each player starts with level 1 first. As you level up your experience(=Power) by defeating a small monster like a rabbit, you can become a more powerful hero. However, you may lose points because of the injuries you suffer from defeating monsters. Do not forget to treat!

New adventurers and heroes may be needed to play more games. For more fun, Eldenia is a constant adventurer.

—description from the designer Yun Young-jin.

Name: End of the Trail: Outlaw Mini-Expansion
Description:
A mini-expansion consisting of an additional face card, the Outlaw, an Outlaw meeple, and four new, optional Joker cards.

As face cards, Outlaws rank above 10 and below Jack.  When an Outlaw is played while Prospecting, players place the Outlaw meeple on any tile or, if already in play, move the Outlaw to a new tile. At game end, the tile containing the Outlaw meeple scores only half its value in gold.

Each Outlaw card features an illustration based on historic outlaws of the California Gold Rush, chosen by backers of the Kickstarter Project.  These include: Joaquin Murrieta, Eleanor Dumont, Black Bart, and Jack Powers.  Illustrations for the Jokers were likewise selected by backers and include depictions of a card shark and a town drunk.

The mini expansion is packaged separately from the base game and will be available to non-Kickstarter backers.
